definition: to come to the surface/to become apparent
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: The incidents are of a more external kind, but very funny.
sentences.chinese: 这些插曲属于非常表面化的那种，但是十分有趣。

sentences.english: Our evident fence around the residence is our confidence of correspondent defence.
sentences.chinese: 我们住宅四周围表面化的栅子是我们相应防卫的信心。

sentences.english: Looks and other more superficial stuff are examples of such things.
sentences.chinese: 比如说外表或者其他一些比较肤浅的表面化的东西。

sentences.english: One of the Powerset innovations is surfacing of semantics to the user interface.
sentences.chinese: powerset创新之一是语义表面化于用户界面。

sentences.english: It wasn't long before Fannie and the administration were effectively at war.
sentences.chinese: 没过多久，房利美与政府的冲突便表面化了。

sentences.english: It is when the hidden decisions are made explicit that the arguments begin.
sentences.chinese: 只有当隐藏的决定表面化时才有争端。

definition: to intensify/to become acute/to come to a head
